	<entry>
		<title>Prism Launcher Release 7.0, now available</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-7.0/"/>
		<updated>2023-06-08T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-7.0/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>Hello!</p>
<p>It has been a while, but we are finally ready to ship version 7.0. This one comes with a lot of new features, although we sadly also have to say goodbye to some features, namely support for Feed-the-Beast modpacks.</p>
<p>Notable features in this release are advanced copy options, a downloader for resource packs, texturepacks and shaderpacks, a new improved progress dialog and support for exporting instances as Modrinth modpacks (.mrpack). This means that modpack authors can finally use Prism Launcher directly for making Modrinth modpacks.<br />
On the other hand we had to remove support for Feed-the-Beast modpacks as requested by the FTB team. Though a FTB App importer might replace this missing feature in a future release. For more information, you can read <a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/ftb-removal/">our other blog post</a>.<br />
Finally, we want to remind users to be more cautious when downloading mods and modpacks as the <a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/"><em>fractureiser</em> malware has been discovered</a>. While both Modrinth and CurseForge have checked and removed the infected mods if necessary, stay on guard for external websites and for the possibility of future Minecraft malware.</p>
<p>We are also happy to have two new maintainers on board! <a href="https://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> and <a href="https://github.com/TayouVR">@TayouVR</a> will be helping out with the development of the launcher. We hope we can get more releases out the door with more hands helping out. Of course we are always happy to see new contributors, so if you think you might be able to help, head over to our GitHub project and see if you might be able to help out.</p>
<p>Until next time!</p>
<h2 id="changelog" tabindex="-1">Changelog <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-7.0/#changelog" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="added" tabindex="-1">Added <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-7.0/#added" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>

<li>Add and improve warnings to destructive actions by <a href="https://github.com/TheKodeToad">@TheKodeToad</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/618">#618</a></li>
<li>Add button to import component JSONs by <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/735">#735</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/895">#895</a></li>
<li>Add file manifest for portable installations by <a href="https://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1101">#1101</a></li>
<li>Add mrpack export by <a href="https://github.com/TheKodeToad">@TheKodeToad</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/904">#904</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1109">#1109</a></li>
<li>Add NilLoader mod metadata support by <a href="https://github.com/kumquat-ir">@kumquat-ir</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/853">#853</a></li>
<li>Add provider column to the mods page by <a href="https://github.com/leo78913">@leo78913</a> and <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/626">#626</a></li>
<li>Add resource pack, texture pack and shader pack downloaders by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> and <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/788">#788</a></li>
<li>Add setting for downloads directory by <a href="https://github.com/Janrupf">@Janrupf</a> and <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/931">#931</a></li>
<li>Add Teawie as an alternative cat (rat?) by <a href="https://github.com/getchoo">@getchoo</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/715">#715</a></li>
<li>Add theme selection to setup wizard by <a href="https://github.com/TayouVR">@TayouVR</a> and <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/249">#249</a></li>
<li>Allow custom Modrinth API token by <a href="https://github.com/TheKodeToad">@TheKodeToad</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/896">#896</a></li>
<li>Allow importing instance resources by <a href="https://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/696">#696</a></li>
<li>Allow selecting a default account to use with an instance by <a href="https://github.com/byteduck">@byteduck</a> and <a href="https://github.com/leo78913">@leo78913</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/685">#685</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1073">#1073</a></li>
<li>Display last launch date in instance description by <a href="https://github.com/japa4551">@japa4551</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1025">#1025</a></li>
<li>[Windows] Add code signing by <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/865">#865</a></li>
</ul>
<h3 id="changed" tabindex="-1">Changed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-7.0/#changed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Divide Minecraft settings page into tabs by <a href="https://github.com/DioEgizio">@DioEgizio</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/950">#950</a></li>
<li>Generalize Mod models / pages and APIs to Resources by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/675">#675</a></li>
<li>Improve detection of blocked mods by <a href="https://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/946">#946</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1054">#1054</a></li>
<li>Improve resource type detection by <a href="https://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/576">#576</a></li>
<li>Improve tasks and progress dialog by <a href="https://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/961">#961</a></li>
<li>Improve version parsing by <a href="https://github.com/Edgars-Cirulis">@Edgars-Cirulis</a>, <a href="https://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> and <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/751">#751</a></li>
<li>Port the MainWindow ui to a .ui file by <a href="https://github.com/leo78913">@leo78913</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/724">#724</a></li>
<li>Refactor <code>shared_qobject_ptr</code> usage by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/787">#787</a></li>
<li>Switch to Qt 6 by default by <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/918">#918</a></li>
<li>Trash instance icons instead of deleting by <a href="https://github.com/leo78913">@leo78913</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/561">#561</a></li>
<li>Update resource and data pack versions by <a href="https://github.com/leo78913">@leo78913</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1117">#1117</a></li>
<li>Update social links by <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1080">#1080</a></li>
<li>[Linux] Improve Nix tooling by <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> and <a href="https://github.com/getchoo">@getchoo</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/888">#888</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/966">#966</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/968">#968</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1093">#1093</a></li>
<li>[macOS] Bump minimum macOS version to 11 by <a href="https://github.com/DioEgizio">@DioEgizio</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1133">#1133</a></li>
<li>[macOS,Windows] Update to Qt 6.5.x by <a href="https://github.com/DioEgizio">@DioEgizio</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/937">#937</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/972">#972</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/983">#983</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1088">#1088</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1131">#1131</a></li>
<li>[Windows] Improve MinGW ccache by <a href="https://github.com/TheLastRar">@TheLastRar</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/803">#803</a></li>
<li>[Windows] Uninstall before installing when using setup by <a href="https://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1100">#1100</a></li>
</ul>
<h3 id="fixed" tabindex="-1">Fixed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-7.0/#fixed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Add Visual Studio files to gitignore by <a href="https://github.com/heftymouse">@heftymouse</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/934">#934</a></li>
<li>Bump ghc-filesystem by <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/912">#912</a></li>

<li>Fix compiler warnings by <a href="https://github.com/Trial97">@Trial97</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1111">#1111</a></li>
<li>Fix crash when selecting resource/texture/shader packs by <a href="https://github.com/leo78913">@leo78913</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1115">#1115</a></li>
<li>Fix crash when selecting same mod from different providers by <a href="https://github.com/Trial97">@Trial97</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1029">#1029</a></li>
<li>Fix failing zip extractions by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/889">#889</a></li>
<li>Fix memory leaks by <a href="https://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1083">#1083</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1108">#1108</a></li>
<li>Fix some regressions in the main window by <a href="https://github.com/leo78913">@leo78913</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/795">#795</a></li>
<li>Fix storing custom meta server URL by <a href="https://github.com/TayouVR">@TayouVR</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1114">#1114</a></li>
<li>Fix windows default apps by <a href="https://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/857">#857</a></li>
<li>Fix Qt event plumbing and networking by <a href="https://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1007">#1007</a></li>
<li>Handle partial lines in LoggedProcess by <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/945">#945</a></li>
<li>Make the logger thread-safe by <a href="https://github.com/KosmX">@KosmX</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/802">#802</a></li>
<li>Replace hoedown markdown parser with CMark by <a href="https://github.com/redstrate">@redstrate</a>, <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> and <a href="https://github.com/DioEgizio">@DioEgizio</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/714">#714</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/783">#783</a></li>
<li>Replace potentially ReDOSable regex by <a href="https://github.com/pandaninjas">@pandaninjas</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/834">#834</a></li>
<li>Update cat immediately by <a href="https://github.com/TayouVR">@TayouVR</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/766">#766</a></li>
<li>Use native path separators for environment variables by <a href="https://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/825">#825</a></li>
<li>[Linux] Fix build failure on KISS Linux by <a href="https://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/859">#859</a></li>
<li>[Linux] Fix Java installation detection by <a href="https://github.com/BalkanMadman">@BalkanMadman</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/823">#823</a></li>
<li>[Linux] Fix MangoHud detection by <a href="https://github.com/getchoo">@getchoo</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/965">#965</a></li>
<li>[Linux] Fix portable launch script shebang by <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/819">#819</a></li>
<li>[Windows] Fix build failure on MinGW by <a href="https://github.com/kthchew">@kthchew</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/927">#927</a></li>
<li>[Windows] Fix Qt 6.5 system theme colors by <a href="https://github.com/TayouVR">@TayouVR</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1086">#1086</a></li>
<li>[Windows] Fix zip extraction by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/911">#911</a></li>
</ul>
<h3 id="removed" tabindex="-1">Removed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-7.0/#removed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>

<p>Full Changelog: <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/compare/6.3...7.0">https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/compare/6.3...7.0</a></p>

	<entry>
		<title>FTB Modpack Downloading Removal.</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/ftb-removal/"/>
		<updated>2023-06-08T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/ftb-removal/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>At the request of Slowpoke, representing the FTB team, we have removed the feature that allows downloading FTB modpacks from Prism Launcher. <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/1040">GitHub PR</a></p>
<p>Existing instances of FTB Modpacks will remain functional, but with the next release, downloading FTB packs within the launcher will no longer be possible.</p>
<p>A way to import FTB Modpacks from the FTB App is planned, though no work was done yet. If you think you can help out, <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/issues/235">join the development over here</a>!</p>
<p>The reason for this request from the FTB team seems to be related to some launchers attempting to monetize FTB Packs.</p>
<h2 id="conversations-with-ftb-team" tabindex="-1">Conversations With FTB Team <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/ftb-removal/#conversations-with-ftb-team" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<p>Note some parts have been removed due to privacy concerns.</p>
<p>Raw screenshots can be found here: <a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/ftb-removal/#raw-screenshots">Raw Screenshots</a></p>
<h3 id="people-involved-in-these-conversations-shown-below" tabindex="-1">People Involved in these conversations shown below <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/ftb-removal/#people-involved-in-these-conversations-shown-below" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<blockquote>
<p>IThundxr<br />
Discord ID: 694604709591384226</p>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Scrumplex<br />
Discord ID: 138352803906191360</p>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Mikey<br />
Discord ID: 196688486357663744</p>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Slowpoke<br />
Discord ID: 104950896491823104</p>
</blockquote>
<h3 id="initial-permission-request" tabindex="-1">Initial Permission Request <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/ftb-removal/#initial-permission-request" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<blockquote>
<p>Hi,<br />
I’m a mod from prism and just confirming that your okay with us using the ftb api as we already do</p>
<ul>
<li>IThundxr</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Thank you for reaching out. Right now, the kinda, &quot;official&quot; statement is that other launchers shouldn't be using our API as it bypasses our ads and thus causes financial loss... I can take this up to my boss and get you an official response.</p>
<p>Do you know the exact way you use our API? The details are kinda important at this stage as how you use it depends on where the line is drawn. We have some relatively strict restrictions on how we're allow to use the Curse API and that propagates down to our API.</p>
<ul>
<li>Mikey</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>we use it for modpacks but CF mods are downloaded through the official curseforge API so it shows a dialog for mods with mod distribution disabled</p>
<ul>
<li>IThundxr</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Using the curseforge object inside our files array?</p>
<ul>
<li>Mikey</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Do u mean like using the curse forge array to find mods with the official api?</p>
<ul>
<li>IThundxr</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>This Object<br />
<img alt="image of the modpacks.ch modpack mod object" src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064872603237498930/1064899187130507284/Screenshot_2023-01-17_at_13.29.01.png" style="width: 30em" /></p>
<ul>
<li>Mikey</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Yea we use that for searching stuff in the official cf api</p>
<ul>
<li>IThundxr</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Then you're not breaking CF's policy. Where that stands with us, I honestly don't know. I'm only the lead software dev, I don't actually deal with business decisions but I'll happily get you an answer to your question.</p>
<ul>
<li>Mikey</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Thanks as we wanna comply with legal rules and regulations and tos<br />
We don’t wanna end up doing or using smt that we aren’t allowed to use</p>
<ul>
<li>IThundxr</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Forwarded this up the chain and I'm being told that as long as you're doing it the way you've said you're doing it then you're all good 👍</p>
<ul>
<li>Mikey</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Ok good to know!</p>
<ul>
<li>IThundxr</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Obviously, this us just saying that what you're doing isn't breaking any official rules. It's not explicit permission. It's just not us revoking permission if that makes sense.<br />
Effectively, it's only confirmation for your use case very specifically 👍</p>
<ul>
<li>Mikey</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<h3 id="request-to-remove-ftb-modpack-downloading" tabindex="-1">Request to Remove FTB Modpack Downloading <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/ftb-removal/#request-to-remove-ftb-modpack-downloading" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<blockquote>
<p>Hi, I see your a community manager, but do you also work on Prism Launcher?</p>
<ul>
<li>Slowpoke</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Hi, yes i do</p>
<ul>
<li>Scrumplex</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Hi, I am not sure if you can point me in the direction of someone who can help me. I work for Feed The Beast (the pack developers) We have recently been contacted by our legal advisors and been told that we unfortunately going to have to change some things that we have overlooked in the past when it comes to other launchers that have been downloading FTB modpacks without permission. Due to this I am contacting the developers of launchers that are currently distributing our packs in the hopes of resolving this without having to take it any further. Can you find out weather you are open to voluntarily removing our packs from the Prism Launcher for me. If you need me to send something official I can do that, but I am hoping we can do this in the easiest way possible.<br />
I was hoping that this was something we would be able to continue to overlook, however that is apparently no longer possible.</p>
<ul>
<li>Slowpoke</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>I assume this is similar to what MultiMC did last year already?</p>
<p>Our main reasoning for not following MultiMC was that we were not contacted ourselves yet. Though we did confirm with FTB team members if our implementations were fine.</p>
<p>Of course i am sad to hear the situation has changed since then, but we would of course comply. We always try to respect upstreams even if it means that we lose a feature or two<br />
Is it okay if I screenshot this and send it to the other maintainers?</p>
<ul>
<li>Scrumplex</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Of course<br />
and as I said, nothing you have done has led to this in any way<br />
We have just found out that there are other launchers on the horizon that intent to make financial gains from the installation of our modpacks and that can cause issues for us, especially if we have no history of being seen to be protecting our IP.<br />
As long as launchers were operating for free, we were able to overlook things. But thats not the case any more.</p>
<ul>
<li>Slowpoke</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<h3 id="additional" tabindex="-1">Additional <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/ftb-removal/#additional" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<blockquote>
<p>Hi,</p>
<p>Reaching out for Prism and I’m wondering what’s lead to us not being allowed to use the api for what we are doing.<br />
Since we got permission before that said we were allowed, anyway I’m not saying we won’t comply just want some more info about this</p>
<ul>
<li>IThundxr</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Hi there<br />
Sorry I was in a meeting.  With regards to the issue, As I told Scrumplex, it is nothing that anyone at Prism has done wrong. We have been informed however that there are several new launchers in development and at least 1 existing launcher that is moving to a model that includes getting income from the installation of mods and modpacks. We have been advised by our legal advisors that because of this, we effectively have to start asking other launchers to no longer allow our packs to be listed. The problem is something to do with it makes it much harder to prevent other launchers from just doing what they want if we have no history of enforcing the protection of our copyright and IP.<br />
I am not a legal expert, so I don’t really have much to say on this other than that this is the advice we have been given so we have to follow it<br />
With regards to permission, as far as I know the only thing that has ever been said is we wont actively chase after people. I don’t think (unless I am remembering wrong and I would in that case want to see evidence of this) we have ever<br />
We have never given anyone permission to distribute our packs other than Curseforge and we don’t upload our packs there any more either</p>
<ul>
<li>Slowpoke</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>Basically Mikey told me the way we were using the api is fine and we are good to continue using it</p>
<ul>
<li>IThundxr</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>This is not what he is saying, he is saying that your not breaking the terms of CurseForge. Also as things stand <a href="http://modpacks.ch/">modpacks.ch</a> is also open.  We are going to be making changes to our packs so that they are clearly covered under an appropriate licence.  Once this has all been done then everything will be much clearer legally. That is why what I sent today was a request at this point. We are going to be making changes to make sure that everything is clear legally with regards to distribution of our packs. But I didn’t want to do this in that order. I thought it was much better to come to you in advance and see if there was a way of us preempting these changes so that it wasn’t just dumped on you without any form of communication.<br />
I don’t really have any issues with any of the other launchers or the people running them. Way back in the day, just so you are aware of how this all happened, we had an arrangement with Forkk where he was able to have packs on his launcher, our only condition was that the modpacks were downloaded through the FTB Launcher. He respected that to start with. Later on down the line the ability to download the packs was added, but that was never done with our consent, By the time it was added, it was already<br />
Established and our main reason at the time for the insistence of downloading though our launcher didn’t really apply to Forkk as we knew him so we let it slide. Since then we have continued with that policy. However the situation has changed dramatically since then and whilst in principle I have no beef with launchers like prism that don’t have any form of income, that cant apply to launchers designed to make income.  Unfortunately the none income making launchers are just getting caught up in the effect that this is going to have on the community.<br />
This is not going to be good for us either.<br />
People will assume its about making as much money as we can, and in reality that does not really have anything to do with it.<br />
The percentage of downloads and plays of our packs from launchers other than our own is less than 10%</p>
<ul>
<li>Slowpoke</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>So for now you just want us to remove ftb modpack downloading and later that might change?</p>
<ul>
<li>IThundxr</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<br />
<blockquote>
<p>To be clear this only applies to anything that comes from <a href="http://modpacks.ch/">modpacks.ch</a>. If you get it from <a href="http://api.feed-the-beast.com/">api.feed-the-beast.com</a> then it is OK. We are not going to lock off access to the legacy packs. If you choose to continue to support those packs then your OK to allow those.</p>
<ul>
<li>Slowpoke</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<h2 id="raw-screenshots" tabindex="-1">Raw screenshots <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/ftb-removal/#raw-screenshots" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<img alt="Reaching out to FTB to ask for permission to use FTB modpacks in prism and they ask for more info how we use the api." src="https://prismlauncher.org/img/news/ftb-removal/request1.png" style="width: 40em" />
<br />
<img alt="Info on how we use the api is provided and they forwarded it to higher ups and reply saying how we use it is fine." src="https://prismlauncher.org/img/news/ftb-removal/request2.png" style="width: 40em" />
<br />
<img alt="They clarify its only confirmation that how we use it is fine." src="https://prismlauncher.org/img/news/ftb-removal/request3.png" style="width: 40em" />
<br />
<img alt="Scrumplex is reached by slowpoke where slowpoke asks for FTB modpack downloading to be removed" src="https://prismlauncher.org/img/news/ftb-removal/request4.png" style="width: 40em" />
<br />
<img alt="Slowpoke clarifies that prism hasn't done anything wrong that has ended up causing this" src="https://prismlauncher.org/img/news/ftb-removal/request5.png" style="width: 40em" />
<br />
<img alt="IThundxr reaches out to slowpoke for further clarification" src="https://prismlauncher.org/img/news/ftb-removal/request6.png" style="width: 40em" />
<br />
<img alt="Slowpoke says overwolf has nothing to do with this decision to make launchers remove FTB modpack downloading" src="https://prismlauncher.org/img/news/ftb-removal/request7.png" style="width: 40em" />
<br />
<img alt="More info is given and basically the decision was made due to a launcher trying to monetize ftb packs." src="https://prismlauncher.org/img/news/ftb-removal/request8.png" style="width: 40em" />
</content>
	</entry>
	
	<entry>
		<title>[MALWARE WARNING] "fractureiser" malware in many popular Minecraft mods and modpacks</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/"/>
		<updated>2023-06-07T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>For a full summary, check out this GitHub repository: <a href="https://github.com/fractureiser-investigation/fractureiser">https://github.com/fractureiser-investigation/fractureiser</a></p>
<p>Starting June 6th, 2023 UTC, multiple groups reported many CurseForge and Bukkit projects as compromised. Malware was been uploaded to several projects and it's now known that the virus was self-replicating and spreading. Since then, both <a href="https://twitter.com/modrinth/status/1666853947804463115">Modrinth</a> and <a href="https://twitter.com/CurseForge/status/1666741580022128641">Curseforge</a> have stated all infected files have been removed or they were unaffected. It should be safe to use these services now, however users should still take caution in downloading files, especially from less trustworthy services.</p>
<div class="notification type-warn">
Following the steps below if you find that you have the virus, remove it then <b>CHANGE ALL OF YOUR PASSWORDS</b> as it is highly likely that the virus is extracting all of your browsers saved passwords.
</div>
<p>Table of contents:</p>
<div class="table-of-contents"><ul><li><a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#what-can-i-do">What can I do? </a><ul><li><a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#checking-mods">Checking Mods </a></li><li><a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#finding-out-if-you-have-already-been-infected">Finding out if you have already been infected </a></li><li><a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#files-were-found!-what-can-i-do">Files were found! What can I do? </a></li></ul></li><li><a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#who-was-affected">Who was affected </a></li><li><a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#what-we-know-about-the-malware">What we know about the malware </a><ul><li><a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#distribution">Distribution </a></li></ul></li><li><a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#technical-info">Technical info </a></li><li><a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#references">References </a><ul><li><a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#luna-pixel-studios">Luna Pixel Studios </a></li><li><a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#it-is-recommended-to-hold-off-on-updating-any-mods-or-modpacks-until-this-is-resolved.">It is recommended to hold off on updating any mods or modpacks until this is resolved. </a></li><li><a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#the-iris-project">The Iris Project </a></li></ul></li></ul></div>
<h2 id="what-can-i-do" tabindex="-1">What can I do? <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#what-can-i-do" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<div class="notification type-warn">
 Windows 10 versions older than 22H2 may not have received this intelligence update yet due to being out of support. We recommend you upgrade to 22H2 in order to continue receiving support from Microsoft.
</div>
<p><b>As of June 8th, 2023 UTC</b>, Windows Defender has started detecting some jars infected with stage 0, along with files from stage 2 (specifically libWebGL64.jar). You should make you have the latest security intelligence updates from Microsoft by going to settings and running Windows Update. To confirm, go to Windows Defender, click &quot;Virus and Threat Protection,&quot; scroll down to &quot;Virus and Threat Protection Updates,&quot; and press &quot;Protection Updates.&quot; It should say the last update was today and the version was created on <b>June 9th, 2023</b>. This will help reduce any damage or further infection caused by jars containing fractureiser.</p>
<p>It is still recommended to read the following steps if you haven't already run a scan or are suspicious of a mod you have downloaded. It is still possible infected jars are on your system, as currently the detection done by Windows Defender for stage 0 files can be inconsistent.</p>
<h3 id="checking-mods" tabindex="-1">Checking Mods <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#checking-mods" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<p>When downloading mods and plugins you may be suspicious of, douira's <a href="https://douira.github.io/fractureiser-web-detector/">Fractureiser Web Scanner</a> can be used to detect if they are infected.</p>
<h3 id="finding-out-if-you-have-already-been-infected" tabindex="-1">Finding out if you have already been infected <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#finding-out-if-you-have-already-been-infected" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<p>Fractureiser drops multiple files on your system. These steps may be used to see if an infected mod has already been run:</p>
<h4 id="manual-check" tabindex="-1">Manual Check <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#manual-check" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h4>
<blockquote>
<p>When checking if you are infected, make sure to make <code>hidden files visible</code> and for windows also disable <code>Hide protected operating system files</code>, for your respective platform.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>Stage 1 of the malware attempts to drop a file into the following locations:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Linux</strong>:</p>
<ul>
<li>Locate it in systemd-utility.service in ~/.config/systemd/user or /etc/systemd/system/ and lib.jar in ~/.config/.data and check SystemCTL for any changes</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Windows</strong>: <code>%LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft Edge\libWebGL64.jar</code> (or <code>~\AppData\Local\Microsoft Edge\libWebGL64.jar</code>)</p>
<ul>
<li>Yes, &quot;Microsoft Edge&quot; with a space</li>
<li>Also check the registry for an entry at <code>HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run</code></li>
<li>Or a shortcut in <code>%appdata%\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup</code></li>
<li>If the file cannot be deleted due to being open in the &quot;Open JDK Binary&quot; you can use <a href="https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/downloads/autoruns">https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/downloads/autoruns</a> to see what applications are on start-up and disable/remove the start up rule for &quot;libWebGL64.jar&quot;</li>
<li>Another solution is to delete java so it cannot run in the Java Runtime Environment, and then you can delete the jar by locating it in in %localappdata%\Microsoft Edge and an entry in HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run or a shortcut in %appdata%\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>All other OSes</strong>: Unaffected. The malware is hardcoded for Windows and Linux only. It is possible it will receive an update adding payloads for other OSes in the future.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>Before downloading, the malware will create the enclosing directory if it does not exist. Windows/MS Edge does not use the &quot;Microsoft Edge&quot;-with-a-space directory, and Linux software likely does not use <code>~/.config/.data</code>, so these folders existing may be a sign that stage1 has executed on a victim computer.</p>
<p>If stage2 successfully downloads, it will attempt to make itself start on boot by modifying the Windows registry, or dropping a systemd unit into <code>/etc/systemd</code>. (The Linux side of this payload is unlikely to work as it requires root privileges.)</p>
<div class="infobox top">
@PandaNinjas has reported:
<p>use your firewall to block outbound connections to 85[.]217[.]144[.]130, and modify your hosts file to include <code>0.0.0.0 files-8ie.pages.dev</code> On linux add that line to /etc/hosts, on windows add that line to C:\Windows\system32\drivers\etc\hosts</p>
</div>
<div class="infobox top">
@orowith2os suggests:
<p>If you use Linux, use the <a href="https://flathub.org/apps/org.prismlauncher.PrismLauncher">PrismLauncher Flatpak</a> and be very careful of what you give it access to through utilities such as Flatseal. By default, it has no access to the needed directories to compromise the system.</p>
<p>Other sandbox escapes may be possible, but the malware most likely doesn't account for running inside of a sandbox of this sort.</p>
</div>
<h4 id="automated-script" tabindex="-1">Automated Script <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#automated-script" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h4>
<div class="infobox top">
@Getchoo has released a linux and windows command line script to quickly check if these files exist:
<p>Windows (powershell, not cmd):</p>
<pre class="language-powershell"><code class="language-powershell"><span class="token variable">$appData</span> = <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$HOME</span>\AppData"</span>
<span class="token variable">$edgePath</span> = <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$appData</span>\Local\Microsoft Edge"</span>

<span class="token variable">$badPaths</span> = @<span class="token punctuation">(</span>
        <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$edgePath</span>\.ref"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
        <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$edgePath</span>\client.jar"</span>
        <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$edgePath</span>\lib.dll"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
        <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$edgePath</span>\libWebGL64.jar"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
        <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$edgePath</span>\run.bat"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
        <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$appData</span>\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\run.bat"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
        <span class="token string">"HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\t"</span>
<span class="token punctuation">)</span>

<span class="token variable">$res</span> = <span class="token boolean">$false</span>

<span class="token keyword">ForEach</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token variable">$Path</span> in <span class="token variable">$badPaths</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
        <span class="token keyword">if</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token function">Test-Path</span> <span class="token operator">-</span>Path <span class="token variable">$Path</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
                <span class="token function">Write-Host</span> <span class="token string">"bad file found! removing <span class="token variable">$Path</span>..."</span>
                <span class="token function">Remove-Item</span> <span class="token operator">-</span>Force <span class="token variable">$Path</span>
                <span class="token variable">$res</span> = <span class="token boolean">$true</span>
        <span class="token punctuation">}</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token keyword">if</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token operator">!</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token variable">$res</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
                <span class="token function">Write-Host</span> <span class="token string">"nothing found! :)"</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token function">Read-Host</span> <span class="token operator">-</span>Prompt <span class="token string">"press any button to exit"</span></code></pre>
<div class="notification type-warn">
To use this file after downloading it to your "Downloads" folder, press Windows key + R, then paste and run `powershell -executionpolicy bypass -file "%UserProfile%\Downloads\check_cf.ps1"`
</div>
<p><a class="button size-medium" href="https://prismlauncher.org/img/news/cf-compromised/check_cf.ps1" download="check_cf.ps1">Download Windows Script</a></p>
<p>Linux:</p>
<pre class="language-bash"><code class="language-bash"><span class="token shebang important">#!/usr/bin/env bash</span>

<span class="token assign-left variable">service_file</span><span class="token operator">=</span><span class="token string">"systemd-utility.service"</span>
<span class="token assign-left variable">data_dir</span><span class="token operator">=</span><span class="token string">"<span class="token environment constant">$HOME</span>/.config/.data"</span>
<span class="token assign-left variable">bad_paths</span><span class="token operator">=</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>
        <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$data_dir</span>/.ref"</span>
        <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$data_dir</span>/client.jar"</span>
        <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$data_dir</span>/lib.jar"</span>
        <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$data_dir</span>/lib.dll"</span>
        <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$data_dir</span>/libWebGL64.jar"</span>
        <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$data_dir</span>/run.bat"</span>
        <span class="token string">"<span class="token environment constant">$HOME</span>/.config/systemd/user/<span class="token variable">$service_file</span>"</span>
        <span class="token string">"/etc/systemd/system/<span class="token variable">$service_file</span>"</span>
<span class="token punctuation">)</span>

<span class="token assign-left variable">res</span><span class="token operator">=</span><span class="token string">"true"</span>
<span class="token keyword">for</span> <span class="token for-or-select variable">path</span> <span class="token keyword">in</span> <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">${bad_paths<span class="token punctuation">[</span>@<span class="token punctuation">]</span>}</span>"</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span> <span class="token keyword">do</span>
        <span class="token keyword">if</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span> <span class="token parameter variable">-f</span> <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$path</span>"</span> <span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span> <span class="token keyword">then</span>
                <span class="token builtin class-name">echo</span> <span class="token string">"bad file found! removing <span class="token variable">$path</span>..."</span>
                <span class="token function">rm</span> <span class="token parameter variable">--force</span> <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$path</span>"</span>
                <span class="token assign-left variable">res</span><span class="token operator">=</span><span class="token string">"false"</span>
        <span class="token keyword">fi</span>
<span class="token keyword">done</span>

<span class="token keyword">if</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span> <span class="token string">"<span class="token variable">$res</span>"</span> <span class="token operator">==</span> <span class="token string">"true"</span> <span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span> <span class="token keyword">then</span>
        <span class="token builtin class-name">echo</span> <span class="token string">"nothing found :)"</span>
<span class="token keyword">fi</span></code></pre>
<div class="notification type-warn">
 To automatically download and run this file, run `curl -fsSL https://prismlauncher.org/img/news/cf-compromised/check_cf.sh | bash`
</div>
<p><a class="button size-medium" href="https://prismlauncher.org/img/news/cf-compromised/check_cf.sh" download="check_cf.sh">Download Linux Script</a></p>
</div>
<h3 id="files-were-found!-what-can-i-do" tabindex="-1">Files were found! What can I do? <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#files-were-found!-what-can-i-do" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<p>As said before, you should first <b>CHANGE ALL OF YOUR PASSWORDS</b>, as it is possible that the virus extracted all of your browsers saved passwords. You should also use MCRcortex's <a href="https://github.com/MCRcortex/nekodetector">nekodetector</a>, which will allow you to scan your entire system for other Java files that may try to create these files again.</p>
<h2 id="who-was-affected" tabindex="-1">Who was affected <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#who-was-affected" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<div class="infobox top">
 This is by no means a complete list, as it is possible other mods were affected. Keep in mind the mods included in this list should be safe now when downloaded from Curseforge, Modrinth, etc.
</div>
<p>According to Luna Pixel Studios, &quot;tens of mods &amp; modpacks, mostly on 1.16.5 1.18.2 and 1.19.2 were updated to include malicious files&quot;</p>
<p>The currently confirmed affected mods and modpacks are as follows:</p>
<p><em>At this point, we have enough samples to know this was quite widespread.</em></p>
<p>CurseForge:</p>
<ul>
<li>Dungeons Arise</li>
<li>Sky Villages</li>
<li>Better MC modpack series</li>
<li><s>Fabuously Optimized</s> (Found to not be compromised)</li>
<li>Dungeonz</li>
<li>Skyblock Core</li>
<li>Vault Integrations</li>
<li>AutoBroadcast</li>
<li>Museum Curator Advanced</li>
<li>Vault Integrations Bug fix</li>
<li>Create Infernal Expansion Plus - Mod removed from CurseForge</li>
</ul>
<p>Bukkit:</p>
<ul>
<li>Display Entity Editor</li>
<li>Haven Elytra</li>
<li>The Nexus Event Custom Entity Editor</li>
<li>Simple Harvesting</li>
<li>MCBounties</li>
<li>Easy Custom Foods</li>
<li>Anti Command Spam Bungeecord Support</li>
<li>Ultimate Leveling</li>
<li>Anti Redstone Crash (Not to be confused with &quot;NTD AntiRedstoneCrash&quot;)</li>
<li>Hydration</li>
<li>Fragment Permission Plugin</li>
<li>No VPNS</li>
<li>Ultimate Titles Animations Gradient RGB</li>
<li>Floating Damage</li>
</ul>
<p>Luna Pixel Studios has stated its very likely someone has found a way to bypass 2fa and login to multiple large CurseForge profiles. The CurseForge profiles are also showing someone logging into them directly.</p>
<h2 id="what-we-know-about-the-malware" tabindex="-1">What we know about the malware <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#what-we-know-about-the-malware" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<p><strong>Notice: Plugins with similar malware have been found as early as mid-April.</strong></p>
<p>A number of CurseForge and <a href="http://dev.bukkit.org/">dev.bukkit.org</a> (not the Bukkit software itself) accounts were compromised, and malicious software was injected into many popular plugins and mods. There are reports of malicious plugin/mod JARs as early as May 22nd.</p>
<p>If you have downloaded any mods from CurseForge, or plugins from Bukkit, even through clients such as Prism Launcher or the official CurseForge launcher, it is recommended that you follow the &quot;Am I infected?&quot; guide below.</p>
<p>The affected accounts had two-factor authentication enabled. It's unlikely this is a simple password compromise situation; it may be auth token compromise or something bigger on the CF side. Multiple accounts are affected so we don't believe this is isolated.</p>
<p>We know platforms such as Modrinth to be unaffected.</p>
<p>It has been found that the information this virus steals is highly likely related to microsoft credentials and browser saved passwords. <strong>RESET ALL OF YOUR PASSWORDS</strong> after you have removed the virus</p>
<h3 id="distribution" tabindex="-1">Distribution <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#distribution" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<p>Some modpacks have had updates published for them without the knowledge of the authors, adding a dependency on malicious mods. These updates were archived immediately after uploading, meaning they <em>do not show on the web UI, only via the API.</em></p>
<p>We cannot tell if the malicious mods were always malicious, or if they got edited. They have upload dates multiple weeks in the past. A CDN compromise or cache poisoning is not out of the question due to Curse's usage of the extremely outdated and insecure MD5 to verify downloads.</p>
<h2 id="technical-info" tabindex="-1">Technical info <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#technical-info" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<p>Please find up to date technical information on the fracturiser github - <a href="https://github.com/fractureiser-investigation/fractureiser">https://github.com/fractureiser-investigation/fractureiser</a></p>
<div class="infobox top">
@orowith2os says:
<p><strong>Note: I don't know Java, this is just me making sense of what I see as best I can.</strong> Others will most likely be able to build on top of this information and explain it in more detail.</p>
<p>Taking a quick look over the decompiled source code, it will indeed fail to function inside of the default PrismLauncher Flatpak sandbox; the current malware hardcodes the user's <code>~/.config/</code> directory. The creation of files inside of the Flatpak sandbox, if the app does not have access to that real path, will result in it being written to a tmpfs that gets wiped on a sandbox restart. systemd is also not available inside of the Flatpak sandbox, so executing that command will fail. The malware seems to not attempt to work around these limitations, and assumes it is running unsandboxed.</p>
</div>
<div class="infobox top">
@getchoo and @Scrumplex says:
<p>**Note: When running Prism Launcher at a user level (i.e., not as root), the services installed by stage 1 of the malware will only be made at a user level - however, due to an invalid <code>WantedBy</code> field these will not work.</p>
<p>This means most Linux users may be unaffected by this, but as the files are still there and could pose a threat, it is still recommended to manually check for the files or the run the script to delete them from your system.</p>
</div>
<h2 id="references" tabindex="-1">References <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#references" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<p><a href="https://github.com/fractureiser-investigation/fractureiser">https://github.com/fractureiser-investigation/fractureiser</a></p>
<h3 id="luna-pixel-studios" tabindex="-1">Luna Pixel Studios <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#luna-pixel-studios" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<div class="infobox top">
 This is an archive of statements by Luna Pixel Studios. Information may or may not be current, and Curseforge should be safe to use now.
</div>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>DO NOT UPDATE MODS OR MODPACKS ON CURSEFORGE.</strong></p>
<p>Several new files have been uploaded to projects by Luna Pixel Studios, including Sky Villages, When Dungeons Arise, and Better MC. These may or may not include malicious files. We are not responsible for this, and currently doing everything we can to remove these files.</p>
<p>This could be due to a CurseForge bug or someone with access to the Luna Pixel Studios account, or even CurseForge itself.</p>
<p>Currently, it is best to avoid downloading files off CurseForge until this is resolved. I will let you all know when this is resolved.</p>
<p>Thank you.</p>
<p>To clear up some questions:</p>
<p>Any launcher that uses CurseForge API is affected, but you are safe as long as you aren't downloading these files.</p>
<p>Nothing will auto-update unless you specifically told a launcher to do so.</p>
<p>These files are not confirmed to be malicious, but we still recommend doing an antivirus scan using Windows Defender.</p>
<p>Summary:</p>
<p>As of a couple hours ago, tens of mods &amp; modpacks, mostly on 1.16.5, 1.18.2 and 1.19.2 have been updated to include malicious files. These projects include When Dungeons Arise, Sky Villages, and the Better MC modpack series. The CurseForge profile of these accounts show someone logging into them directly.</p>
<p>It is very likely that someone has access to several large CurseForge profiles and have found a way of bypassing 2FA to log into them.</p>
<p>You can see here that the Fabulously Optimized team was also affected: <a href="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/790275974503202857/1115801834746023946/image.png">https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/790275974503202857/1115801834746023946/image.png</a></p>
<p>One of the malicious mods, DungeonsX, shows this code when decompiled: <a href="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/790275974503202857/1115801511411335228/image.png">https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/790275974503202857/1115801511411335228/image.png</a></p>
<p>The main payload being sent from this code can be viewed here: <a href="https://pastebin.com/k2ZQKbEz">https://pastebin.com/k2ZQKbEz</a></p>
<p>The DungeonsX mod downloads a jar file and loads it into minecraft, executes a function that downloads the program again, and saves it as a self running file. This mod has been added to all of Luna Pixel Studio's modpacks, and the files were immediately archived by the bad actor. It can be assumed that these files will become available again later, exposing hundreds of thousands of people to malware.</p>
<p>This code allows the mod to be used as a botnet and leave a backdoor on devices: <a href="https://chorb.is-from.space/DiscordPTB_gzDJsWklzc.png">https://chorb.is-from.space/DiscordPTB_gzDJsWklzc.png</a></p>
<p>The code being executed mainly targets Linux users, likely with the intent of infecting servers. This will still affect people on Windows.</p>
<p>The only file from this incident which is not already archived is <a href="https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/skyblock-core/files/4570565">https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/skyblock-core/files/4570565</a>.<br />
This file was archived, but gained 10 downloads in that time, implying it's being shared on other platforms: <a href="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/856652644113580072/1115811476591095908/image.png">https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/856652644113580072/1115811476591095908/image.png</a></p>
<h3 id="it-is-recommended-to-hold-off-on-updating-any-mods-or-modpacks-until-this-is-resolved." tabindex="-1">It is recommended to hold off on updating any mods or modpacks until this is resolved. <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#it-is-recommended-to-hold-off-on-updating-any-mods-or-modpacks-until-this-is-resolved." aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
</blockquote>
<h3 id="the-iris-project" tabindex="-1">The Iris Project <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/cf-compromised-alert/#the-iris-project" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<blockquote>
<p>We have reason to believe many accounts on CurseForge have been hacked and are uploading malicious files containing bot-nets. Luna Pixel Studios, the owner of many big modpacks, is one of the affected accounts.<br />
The situation is being actively looked into.</p>
</blockquote>
</content>
	</entry>
	
	<entry>
		<title>[SECURITY UPDATE] Prism Launcher Release 6.3, now available</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.3/"/>
		<updated>2023-02-03T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.3/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>Update: If you are on a version before 6.2, you should upgrade to this release to avoid a security bug regarding <code>.mrpack</code> modpack imports. You can read more about this in <a href="https://quiltmc.org/en/blog/2023-02-04-five-installer-vulnerabilities/">this blog post from QuiltMC</a>.</p>
<p>Hello!</p>
<p>Uh, wasn't there a release today already? Well yes there was. It's just that the last update added a new security check for instance components, which sadly made Prism Launcher think that Fabric and Quilt are invalid.<br />
Note that this issue won't cause permanent damage, as that check is done on runtime and is purely for informational purposes.</p>
<p>Make sure to read the <a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.2/">previous changelog here</a> to see the other changes as well!</p>
<h2 id="changelog" tabindex="-1">Changelog <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.3/#changelog" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="fixed" tabindex="-1">Fixed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.3/#fixed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Fix regex pattern for component UIDs by <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/815">#815</a></li>
</ul>
<p>Full Changelog: <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/compare/6.2...6.3">https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/compare/6.2...6.3</a></p>
<p>You can <a href="https://prismlauncher.org/download/">grab the latest download here</a> for your respective platform.</p>
</content>
	</entry>
	
	<entry>
		<title>Prism Launcher Release 6.2, now available</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.2/"/>
		<updated>2023-02-03T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.2/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>Hello!</p>
<p>This is a small update that fixes some issues, most notably a nasty issue when importing .mrpack file.<br />
Thanks to all contributors!</p>
<h2 id="changelog" tabindex="-1">Changelog <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.2/#changelog" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="added" tabindex="-1">Added <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.2/#added" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Make use of logging categories for authentication data logging by <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/684">#684</a></li>
</ul>
<h3 id="changed" tabindex="-1">Changed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.2/#changed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Detect jars from within build folder for development builds by <a href="https://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/781">#781</a></li>
<li>Improve the reliability of the Task's stack overflow test by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/804">#804</a></li>
<li>Correctly parse metadata from some misbehaving Forge mods by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/743">#743</a></li>
<li>Remove commit hash from builds where git wasn't installed at build time by <a href="https://github.com/getchoo">@getchoo</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/666">#666</a></li>
<li>Skip some HTML in markdown rendering by <a href="https://github.com/redstrate">@redstrate</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/713">#713</a></li>
<li>Update application metadata by <a href="https://github.com/AshtakaOOf">@AshtakaOOf</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/680">#680</a></li>
<li>Update copyright notice by <a href="https://github.com/RaptaG">@RaptaG</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/746">#746</a></li>
<li>Use Qt logging facilities instead of our own by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/665">#665</a></li>
<li>[Windows] Let Qt handle dark mode titlebar by <a href="https://github.com/TheLastRar">@TheLastRar</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/726">#726</a></li>
<li>[Windows] Update MSVC builds to Qt 6.4.2 by <a href="https://github.com/DioEgizio">@DioEgizio</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/716">#716</a></li>
</ul>
<h3 id="fixed" tabindex="-1">Fixed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.2/#fixed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Better check file paths in .mrpack import and json components by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> and <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/810">#810</a></li>
<li>Fix crashes when running a lot of concurrent tasks by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/758">#758</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/784">#784</a></li>
<li>Fix importing 1.16+ Forge Technic Launcher packs by <a href="https://github.com/byquanton">@byquanton</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/710">#710</a></li>
<li>Improve handing of ZLib submodule by <a href="https://github.com/TheLastRar">@TheLastRar</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/772">#772</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/779">#779</a></li>
<li>[Windows] Fix random ResourceFolderModel test failures on some Windows builds by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/731">#731</a></li>
</ul>
<p>Full Changelog: <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/compare/6.1...6.2">https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/compare/6.1...6.2</a></p>
<p>You can <a href="https://prismlauncher.org/download/">grab the latest download here</a> for your respective platform.</p>
</content>
	</entry>
	
	<entry>
		<title>Prism Launcher Release 6.1, now available</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.1/"/>
		<updated>2022-12-19T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.1/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>Hello!</p>
<p>This is a small update that fixes some issues, most of which were introduced by our previous 6.0 release.<br />
Thanks to all contributors!</p>
<h2 id="changelog" tabindex="-1">Changelog <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.1/#changelog" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="changed" tabindex="-1">Changed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.1/#changed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Move cat to the bottom right by <a href="https://github.com/DioEgizio">@DioEgizio</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/612">#612</a></li>
<li>Only show scrollbars when needed by <a href="https://github.com/leo78913">@leo78913</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/630">#630</a></li>
<li>[Linux] Update Nix packaging by <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/647">#647</a></li>
<li>[Windows] Improve MSVC build flags by <a href="https://github.com/getchoo">@getchoo</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/631">#631</a></li>
</ul>
<h3 id="fixed" tabindex="-1">Fixed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.1/#fixed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Avoid deadlock when there are a lot of resource packs in an instance by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/628">#628</a></li>
<li>Correctly set component versions in Modrinth pack updating by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> and <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/636">#636</a></li>
<li>Fix crash when changing styles by <a href="https://github.com/TheLastRar">@TheLastRar</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/600">#600</a></li>
<li>Fix importing modpacks using ZIP files by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/607">#607</a></li>
<li>Fix possible crash in mod and modpack downloaders with images by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/605">#605</a></li>
<li>Fix wordings in modpack updater by <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/601">#601</a></li>
<li>Fix warning about QMap by <a href="https://github.com/Edgars-Cirulis">@Edgars-Cirulis</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/625">#625</a></li>
<li>[Linux] Fix crash when using Qt GTK2 style by <a href="https://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/604">#604</a></li>
<li>[Windows] Fix automated WinGet releases by <a href="https://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/593">#593</a> <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/649">#649</a></li>
</ul>
<h3 id="removed" tabindex="-1">Removed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.1/#removed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Remove unused DLLs/dylibs from builds by <a href="https://github.com/DioEgizio">@DioEgizio</a> in <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/642">#642</a></li>
</ul>
<p>Full Changelog: <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/compare/6.0...6.1">https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/compare/6.0...6.1</a></p>
<p>You can <a href="https://prismlauncher.org/download/">grab the latest download here</a> for your respective platform.</p>
</content>
	</entry>
	
	<entry>
		<title>Prism Launcher Release 6.0, now available</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.0/"/>
		<updated>2022-12-12T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.0/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>Hello!</p>
<p>This new release brings a lot of new features and improvements to the launcher. Some highlights include a modpack update page, a migration dialog for migrating from other MultiMC-based launchers, an improved blocked mods workaround on CurseForge, redesigned instance icons, integrated shortcut creation, 3 new icon packs including Flat (White), Breeze Dark and Breeze Light and more! This release also includes a few bug fixes of course.<br />
Thanks to all contributors, who have worked on this release!</p>
<h2 id="changelog" tabindex="-1">Changelog <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.0/#changelog" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="added" tabindex="-1">Added <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.0/#added" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Add agents button to instance settings by <a href="http://github.com/TheKodeToad">@TheKodeToad</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/423">#423</a></li>
<li>Add breeze icons by <a href="http://github.com/TayouVR">@TayouVR</a> and <a href="http://github.com/DioEgizio">@DioEgizio</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/487">#487</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/572">#572</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/584">#584</a></li>
<li>Add shortcut creation button by <a href="http://github.com/Leo40Git">@Leo40Git</a>, <a href="http://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> and <a href="http://github.com/DioEgizio">@DioEgizio</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/227">#227</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/521">#521</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/565">#565</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/568">#568</a></li>
<li>Add new cats by <a href="http://github.com/santiagocezar">@santiagocezar</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/372">#372</a></li>
<li>Add an option to lock the toolbars by <a href="http://github.com/leo78913">@leo78913</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/383">#383</a></li>
<li>Add commit hash to <code>--version</code> by <a href="http://github.com/FayneAldan">@FayneAldan</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/431">#431</a></li>
<li>Add flat white icons by <a href="http://github.com/he3als">@he3als</a>, <a href="http://github.com/Protrikk">@Protrikk</a> and <a href="http://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/65">#65</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/506">#506</a></li>
<li>Add icons to the instance context menu and toolbar by <a href="http://github.com/leo78913">@leo78913</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/187">#187</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/267">#267</a></li>
<li>Add migration dialog by <a href="http://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/243">#243</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/498">#498</a></li>
<li>Add modpack update page in instance settings by <a href="http://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/32">#32</a></li>
<li>Add more options to copy instance dialog by <a href="http://github.com/marcelohdez">@marcelohdez</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/242">#242</a></li>
<li>Add missing icons to the legacy icon theme by <a href="http://github.com/leo78913">@leo78913</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/412">#412</a></li>
<li>Add new default instance icons by <a href="http://github.com/santiagocezar">@santiagocezar</a> <a href="http://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> and <a href="http://github.com/DioEgizio">@DioEgizio</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/238">#238</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/556">#556</a></li>
<li>Add proper server icon by <a href="http://github.com/DioEgizio">@DioEgizio</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/546">#546</a></li>
<li>Add smart resource pack parsing for dropping/opening files with Prism Launcher by <a href="http://github.com/ryanccn">@ryanccn</a>, <a href="http://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> and <a href="http://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/481">#481</a></li>
<li>Add spooky kitty for halloween by <a href="http://github.com/leozamboni">@leozamboni</a>, <a href="http://github.com/AshtakaOOf">@AshtakaOOf</a> and <a href="http://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/396">#396</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/405">#405</a></li>
<li>Add support for multiple custom themes by <a href="http://github.com/TayouVR">@TayouVR</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/149">#149</a></li>
<li>Add theme switcher to menu bar by <a href="http://github.com/RedsonBr140">@RedsonBr140</a> and <a href="http://github.com/leo78913">@leo78913</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/454">#454</a></li>
<li>Add Windows on ARM builds by <a href="http://github.com/DioEgizio">@DioEgizio</a> and <a href="http://github.com/TheLastRar">@TheLastRar</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/524">#524</a></li>
<li>Allow Prism to open an instance's window from command line by <a href="http://github.com/Hibiii">@Hibiii</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/211">#211</a></li>
<li>Allow hiding buttons in instance pages by <a href="http://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/486">#486</a></li>
<li>Allow &quot;Open with&quot; for .zip/.mrpack files by <a href="http://github.com/ryanccn">@ryanccn</a>, <a href="http://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> and <a href="http://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/229">#229</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/266">#266</a></li>
<li>Handle links to other mods inside the mod browser by <a href="http://github.com/TheKodeToad">@TheKodeToad</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/367">#367</a></li>
<li>[Linux] Add automated Flatpak builds for nightly builds by <a href="http://github.com/DioEgizio">@DioEgizio</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/456">#456</a></li>
<li>[Linux] Add Nix build and Cachix bucket by <a href="http://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/493">#493</a></li>
<li>[Linux] Add support for Snap builds by <a href="http://github.com/piperswe">@piperswe</a> and <a href="http://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/294">#294</a></li>
<li>[macOS] Add button to add Prism Launcher to PATH by <a href="http://github.com/ryanccn">@ryanccn</a> and <a href="http://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/112">#112</a></li>
<li>[Windows] Add builds using MSVC by <a href="http://github.com/TheLastRar">@TheLastRar</a> and <a href="http://github.com/DioEgizio">@DioEgizio</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/366">#366</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/411">#411</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/448">#448</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/464">#464</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/508">#508</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/514">#514</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/527">#527</a></li>
</ul>
<h3 id="changed" tabindex="-1">Changed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-6.0/#changed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Correct wording on libraries download task by <a href="http://github.com/unascribed">@unascribed</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/587">#587</a></li>
<li>Choose default maximum memory allocation based on system memory by <a href="http://github.com/txtsd">@txtsd</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/392">#392</a></li>
<li>Improve Blocked Mods Dialog and detect manually downloaded mods automatically by <a href="http://github.com/Ryex">@Ryex</a> and <a href="http://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/304">#304</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/439">#439</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/511">#511</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/557">#557</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/571">#571</a> <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/575">#575</a></li>
<li>Improve CurseForge modpack browser by <a href="http://github.com/forkiesassds">@forkiesassds</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/215">#215</a></li>
<li>Major refactor to Java launcher library by <a href="http://github.com/TheKodeToad">@TheKodeToad</a> and <a href="http://github.com/solonovamax">@solonovamax</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/291">#291</a></li>
<li>Make resource buttons work when instance is running by <a href="http://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> and <a href="http://github.com/flowln">@flowln</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/528">#528</a></li>
<li>Update tomlplusplus by <a href="http://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/459">#459</a></li>
<li>Validate maximum memory allocation by <a href="http://github.com/Scrumplex">@Scrumplex</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/436">#436</a></li>
<li>Warn before trashing instances by <a href="http://github.com/ryanccn">@ryanccn</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/541">#541</a></li>
<li>[Linux] Improve detection of MangoHud by <a href="http://github.com/Jan200101">@Jan200101</a> in <a href="http://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/pull/569">#569</a></li>

	<entry>
		<title>Prism Launcher Release 5.1, now available</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-5.1/"/>
		<updated>2022-11-01T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-5.1/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>Hi there!</p>
<p>We are bringing you Prism Launcher 5.1!<br />
This is our first patch release after the <em>thing</em>.<br />
While we promised to bring you a blog article about the <em>thing</em>, it seems like interest has died down and there are many good write-ups/explanations of the situation on the internet.<br />
We did update <a href="https://prismlauncher.org/wiki/overview/faq">our FAQ</a> though, so feel free to read that.</p>
<p>Now to the update.<br />
This mainly consists of bug fixes, nothing too exciting.<br />
Other than that Windows users might like our new 64-bit builds.<br />
We are already hyped for our next feature release though, which will bring some UI improvements.</p>
<h2 id="changelog" tabindex="-1">Changelog <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-5.1/#changelog" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>

</ul>

<li>Remove duplicate Java entries from Auto-detect by @AliceDTRH in #234</li>
<li>Renamed inappropriate instances of &quot;PrismLauncher&quot; to &quot;Prism Launcher&quot; by @ZombieNub in #148</li>
<li>Retry mod search job after aborting it by @flowln in #283</li>
<li>Update credits by @Scrumplex in #338</li>
<li>Update dependencies by @renovate[bot] in #197 #198</li>
