	<entry>
		<title>Prism Launcher Release 5.0, now available</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-5.0/"/>
		<updated>2022-10-19T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-5.0/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>Hi there!</p>
<p>We are bringing you <s>PolyMC</s> Prism Launcher 5.0!<br />
This major release not only comes with a new versioning system, but also a new name!<br />
But why you ask?<br />
Well, stuff happened and we are going to talk about everything that went down in a future blog post.<br />
For now, we want you to regain access to the best Minecraft launcher out there.</p>
<p>Let's go over the major changes since the last <em>PolyMC</em> release back in September.<br />
Our macOS users on Apple M1/M2 processors as well as our Nintendo Switch Linuxers can rejoice, as you can finally run all Minecraft versions on those platforms without needing to make any changes on your end.<br />
We have to thank <a href="https://github.com/r58playz/">some</a> <a href="https://github.com/theofficialgman/">community</a> <a href="https://github.com/ViRb3">members</a> as well as the folks over at <a href="https://github.com/MinecraftMachina/">MinecraftMachina</a> for helping out with this feature!</p>
<p>Apart from support for ARM64/ARM32 processors we are also bringing you our new modpack updater!<br />
For now this feature is limited to Modrinth and CurseForge modpacks.<br />
The process is a bit convoluted currently, but we hope to make it easier in the future with some upcoming UI changes.<br />
Please make a backup of your files before updating a modpack, as it is still a very early feature and we don't want you to lose anything you might want to keep.</p>
<p>As always we need to thank EVERYONE who contributed to PolyMC as well as Prism Launcher.<br />
Special thanks to our community members <a href="https://cmdplusv.neocities.org/">Boba</a>, <a href="https://auti.one/">Davi Rafael</a>, @elyrodso, <a href="https://www.fulmine.xyz/">Fulmine</a>, @gonsawa, Pankakes and @tobimori who collaborated on our gorgeous logo.</p>
<h2 id="changelog" tabindex="-1">Changelog <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-5.0/#changelog" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="added" tabindex="-1">Added <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-5.0/#added" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Add arm64 and arm32 support by @Scrumplex, @r58playz and @theofficialgman in #26 PolyMC/PolyMC#1033</li>
<li>Add basic resource/texture pack parsing and fix issues by @flowln and @Scrumplex in PolyMC/PolyMC#1105 PolyMC/PolyMC#1108 PolyMC/PolyMC#1150 PolyMC/PolyMC#1154</li>
<li>Add clear metadata action by @Scrumplex in #29</li>
<li>Add early modpack updating system by @flowln and @timoreo22 in PolyMC/PolyMC#894</li>
<li>Add image support for mod/modpack pages by @flowln in #31</li>
<li>Add Launch Demo button by @jopejoe1 and @flowln in PolyMC/PolyMC#903</li>
<li>Add Open All button to blocked mods dialog by @kumquat-ir in PolyMC/PolyMC#919</li>
<li>Detect GameMode and MangoHud, disable if not present by @Scrumplex in PolyMC/PolyMC#1034</li>
<li>Enable dark titlebar on Windows 10 by @DavidoTek in PolyMC/PolyMC#982</li>
<li>Preliminary work towards ATLauncher pack updates by @jamierocks in PolyMC/PolyMC#897</li>
<li>Trash instances instead of deleting by @ryanccn in PolyMC/PolyMC#549</li>
<li>[Windows] Find Java installs from PATH by @TayouVR in PolyMC/PolyMC#1068</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="changed" tabindex="-1">Changed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-5.0/#changed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Allow double clicking to mark mods for download by @ErogigGit in PolyMC/PolyMC#1165</li>
<li>Allow modifying some resource while the instance is running by @CutestNekoAqua in #59</li>
<li>Improve language model by @Scrumplex in PolyMC/PolyMC#1164</li>
<li>Improve loading speed of the application by @flowln in PolyMC/PolyMC#878</li>
<li>Merge Launch Buttons by @TayouVR in PolyMC/PolyMC#1190</li>
<li>Support new Prism Launcher data path by @Scrumplex, @flowln and @FayneAldan in #25 #55 #82 #88</li>
<li>Reduce code duplication in tasks, fix some bugs and add some tests by @flowln in PolyMC/PolyMC#966</li>
<li>Refactor resource models by @flowln in PolyMC/PolyMC#1052 PolyMC/PolyMC#1094</li>
<li>Restructure Instance sidebar by @DioEgizio in #33</li>
<li>Restructure tests by @Scrumplex in PolyMC/PolyMC#1133</li>
<li>Switch to new API keys by @Scrumplex in #23</li>
<li>Switch to new branding by @Scrumplex, @NotNite in #13 #45 #54 #60 #92 #110</li>
<li>Switch to new versioning scheme by @Scrumplex in PolyMC/PolyMC#992</li>
<li>Switch to QCommandLineParser by @Scrumplex in PolyMC/PolyMC#1167</li>
<li>Switch to QSharedPointer by @flowln in PolyMC/PolyMC#1023</li>
<li>Switch to std::filesystem where possible by @flowln in PolyMC/PolyMC#1142</li>
<li>UI / UX improvements to the mod downloader by @flowln in PolyMC/PolyMC#939</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="fixed" tabindex="-1">Fixed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-5.0/#fixed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Add missing includes to fix Qt 6.4 build by @Scrumplex in PolyMC/PolyMC#1172</li>
<li>Allow adding MSA account on first start by @Scrumplex in PolyMC/PolyMC#1183</li>
<li>Allow starting rd- versions by @Scrumplex in PolyMC/PolyMC#1146</li>
<li>Fix aborting network jobs by @flowln in PolyMC/PolyMC#1123</li>
<li>Fix and improve FTB modpack installation by @flowln in #27</li>
<li>Fix hosted weblate translation website URL by @nightsnowlinouo in #68</li>
<li>Fix instance copy on Linux and macOS by @flowln in #25</li>
<li>Fix mod icon issues and change delegate for Modrinth Modpacks by @flowln in PolyMC/PolyMC#1163</li>
<li>Fix version filter in mod downloader by @flowln in PolyMC/PolyMC#997</li>
<li>Remove opted out versions from the download selector when using the 'Any' filter by @flowln in PolyMC/PolyMC#1194</li>
<li>Update libnbtplusplus submodule's URL by @flowln and @Scrumplex in #48</li>
<li>Update licensing information by @DioEgizio in #36</li>
<li>Update login message box by @Ozynt in PolyMC/PolyMC#1175</li>
<li>Use system gamemode client if possible by @Scrumplex in PolyMC/PolyMC#1210</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="removed" tabindex="-1">Removed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-5.0/#removed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Remove outdated information about &quot;upcoming&quot; mod updater by @DioEgizio in PolyMC/PolyMC#1185</li>
<li>Remove unused libraries by @DioEgizio in PolyMC/PolyMC#1208</li>
</ul>
<p>Full Changelog: <a href="https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/compare/1.4.2...5.0">https://github.com/PrismLauncher/PrismLauncher/compare/1.4.2...5.0</a></p>
<p>You can <a href="https://prismlauncher.org/download/">grab the latest download here</a> for your respective platform.</p>
</content>
	</entry>
	
	<entry>
		<title>PolyMC Update 1.4.2, now available</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.4.2/"/>
		<updated>2022-09-08T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.4.2/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>It has been a while.<br />
With this wonderful new version you get many cool things, like bug fixes and also bug fixes!</p>

	<entry>

	<entry>
		<title>PolyMC Update 1.4.0, now available</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.4.0/"/>
		<updated>2022-07-23T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.4.0/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>Whoa! There have been a few things since our last feature release almost two months ago!</p>
<p>Major new features include the new mod updater and Qt 6 support.<br />
Don't worry, Qt 5 will still be supported and packages using it will still be available for some time.</p>
<p>If you are a macOS user, you might be delighted to hear, that this will be the first version that ships with an updater!</p>
<p>As a Linux user, you should definitely take a look at the new <code>Performance</code> tab in the settings.<br />
No longer should you need to deal with wrapper commands to enable <a href="https://github.com/flightlessmango/MangoHud">MangoHud</a>, <a href="https://github.com/FeralInteractive/gamemode">GameMode</a> or to utilize your dedicated GPU in a hybrid GPU setup.</p>
<p>Thanks to all contributors, who have worked on this release!</p>
<h2 id="changelog" tabindex="-1">Changelog <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.4.0/#changelog" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="added" tabindex="-1">Added <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.4.0/#added" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Add concurrent tasks by @flowln in #786</li>
<li>Add more links to mod and modpack descriptions by @flowln and @DioEgizio in #634 #799</li>
<li>Add news reader in the launcher by @flowln in #845</li>
<li>Add on-disk mod metadata information by @flowln and @Scrumplex in #426 #714 #716 #759</li>
<li>Implement mod updater by @flowln in #588</li>
<li>Preliminary work for modpack updates by @jamierocks in #665</li>

	<entry>
		<title>PolyMC Update 1.3.1, now available</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.3.1/"/>
		<updated>2022-05-29T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.3.1/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>Hey, it's that time again!<br />
This time you only get some small tweaks and fixes.<br />
With this release downloading CurseForge packs should be a better experience, as now the launcher will tell you what mods could not be downloaded.<br />
Please make sure to download all those mods, otherwise you won't have the full modpack.</p>
<h2 id="changelog" tabindex="-1">Changelog <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.3.1/#changelog" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="added" tabindex="-1">Added <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.3.1/#added" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Add code style configuration by @ryanccn in #623</li>
<li>Add modpack version in the name for FTB legacy packs by @Scrumplex in #672</li>
<li>[Windows] Add desktop shortcut in the installer by @kthchew in #629</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="changed" tabindex="-1">Changed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.3.1/#changed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Clarify T&amp;C for API keys by @Scrumplex in #659</li>
<li>Improve download speed when using the CurseForge API by @timoreo22 in #611</li>
<li>Improve whitelisted hosts filtering code by @LennyMcLennington in #661</li>
<li>Make JVM arguments text-field multi-line by @ryanccn in #624</li>
<li>Remove CurseForge API workaround on modpacks by @Scrumplex in #645</li>
<li>Show metaserver URL instead of <code>(default)</code> by @ryanccn in #642</li>
<li>Update Nix support by @muscaln in #653 and #675</li>
<li>Warn the user of non-whitelisted hosts in mrpacks by @flowln in #661</li>
<li>[macOS] Switch background of icon to white by @ryanccn in #625</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="fixed" tabindex="-1">Fixed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.3.1/#fixed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Correctly handle ATL packs when <code>mainClass</code> has a <code>depends</code> field by @jamierocks in #630</li>
<li>Fix crash when aborting instance import by @JJL772 in #657</li>
<li>Fix icon importing when using non-standard icon paths by @flowln in #650</li>
<li>Fix missing mnemonics in the API page by @Scrumplex in #651</li>
<li>Fix modpack's type inference when importing by @Scrumplex in #639 and #671</li>
<li>Fix search filters for Modrinth by @timoreo22 in #677</li>
<li>Properly fix CurseForge modpack installation by @timoreo22 in #611 and @Scrumplex in #674</li>
<li>Silence unimportant build warnings by @kthchew in #631</li>
<li>[Linux] Add missing image-format libraries for the AppImage by @DioEgizio in #618</li>
<li>[Linux] Fix image sizes in Flathub by @byquanton in #637</li>
<li>[Windows] Correctly set PolyMC's version for binaries by @Scrumplex in #669</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="removed" tabindex="-1">Removed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.3.1/#removed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>

</ul>

	<entry>
		<title>PolyMC Update 1.3.0, now available</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.3.0/"/>
		<updated>2022-05-22T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.3.0/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>Hey!<br />
It's update-time again. This time we bring you some highlights, like Modrinth modpack support, a Windows installer, more paste services and improvements around our ATLauncher support.<br />
There is also a breaking change affecting older platforms.<br />
We have bumped our Qt dependency requirement to version 5.12.<br />
If you user an older platform, you might still be able to run PolyMC through our existing distribution methods (AppImage, Flatpak on Linux).</p>
<p>Initially this release should have included a workaround for download issues with CurseForge mods and modpacks, but we were contacted by CurseForge to remove our workaround.</p>
<h2 id="changelog" tabindex="-1">Changelog <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.3.0/#changelog" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="added" tabindex="-1">Added <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.3.0/#added" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Support ATLauncher share codes by @jamierocks in #408</li>
<li>Allow changing metadata-server settings by @dada513 in #425</li>
<li>Add PolyMC icon as instance icon by @ryanccn in #498</li>
<li>Add option to always hide Java setup wizard by @dada513 in #511</li>
<li>Add support for <a href="http://paste.gg/">paste.gg</a>, hastebin and <a href="http://mclo.gs/">mclo.gs</a> paste services by @LennyMcLennington in #554</li>
<li>Add instance overrides for miscellaneous settings by @kthchew in #560</li>
<li>Modrinth modpack support by @flowln and @Scrumplex in #565</li>
<li>Quilt mod metadata support by @Scrumplex in #567 and @DioEgizio in #590</li>
<li>Support Mojang's new split natives by @Scrumplex in #594</li>
<li>Allow changing CurseForge api key settings by @dada513 in #607</li>
<li>[macOS] Add Big Sur-style icon by @ryanccn in #495</li>
<li>[Windows] Add Windows installer by @kthchew in #576</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="changed" tabindex="-1">Changed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.3.0/#changed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Bump Qt requirement to 5.12 by @Scrumplex in #127</li>
<li>Refactor launcher code by @icelimetea in #486 #520</li>
<li>Refactor network code by @flowln in #500</li>
<li>Speedup automatic builds by @txtsd in #510 #614</li>
<li>Make profile selection menu scrollable by @kthchew in #546</li>
<li>Switch to new CurseForge API Key by @ZekeSmith in #557</li>
<li>Improve behavior when multiple mod loaders are in use by @Scrumplex in #597</li>
<li>Various improvements to ATLauncher support by @jamierocks in #605</li>
<li>Switch to a better CurseForge icon by @DioEgizio in #612</li>
<li>Improve compile parameters by @Scrumplex in #616 #620</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="fixed" tabindex="-1">Fixed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.3.0/#fixed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Always build iconfix as static library by @flowln in #477</li>
<li>Added and fixed mnemonics by @dschemp in #480 and @txtsd in #503</li>
<li>Fix selection of .zip files by @flowln in #528</li>
<li>Fix graphical issue when moving toolbars by @flowln in #529</li>
<li>Fix missing translations when switching languages by @kthchew in #539</li>
<li>Fix missing screenshots in screenshot manager by @kthchew in #540</li>
<li>Fix website link in CurseForge modpacks by @DioEgizio in #545</li>
<li>Hide temporary directory inside instances directory by @kthchew in #547</li>
<li>Fix icons not showing in some FTB modpacks by @flowln in #564</li>
<li>Fix toolbar disappearing in a certain circumstance by @LennyMcLennington in #577</li>
<li>Fix issue with <a href="https://solder.io/">Solder.cf Technic packs</a> by @flowln in #592</li>
<li>[macOS] Fix Steam overlay on macOS by @kthchew in #568</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="removed" tabindex="-1">Removed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.3.0/#removed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Remove unneeded build files by @Scrumplex in #519</li>
<li>Remove references to legacy Minecraft accounts by @Ozynt in #531</li>
<li>Remove self-promotion from game client to reduce fingerprinting by @jamierocks in #606</li>
<li>[macOS] Remove old macOS migration code by @kthchew in #489</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Full Changelog</strong>: <a href="https://github.com/PolyMC/PolyMC/compare/1.2.2...1.3.0">https://github.com/PolyMC/PolyMC/compare/1.2.2...1.3.0</a></p>
<p>You can <a href="https://prismlauncher.org/download">grab the latest download here</a> for your respective platform.</p>
</content>

	<entry>
		<title>PolyMC Update 1.2.2, now available (CurseForge Hotfix)</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.2.2/"/>
		<updated>2022-05-08T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.2.2/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>The old API we used for CurseForge will stop working soon.<br />
This update switches to the new CurseForge Core API to keep modpacks and mod downloads working.</p>
<p>Thanks to everyone who collaborated on this solution in our community channels.</p>

<li>Implemented a workaround to allow Mojang logins by @TheCodex6824 in #482</li>
<li>Move to new CurseForge Core API by @ryanccn in #530</li>
<li>[Linux] Fix AppImage scaling issues by @DioEgizio in #492</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Full Changelog</strong>: <a href="https://github.com/PolyMC/PolyMC/compare/1.2.1...1.2.2">https://github.com/PolyMC/PolyMC/compare/1.2.1...1.2.2</a></p>
<p>You can <a href="https://prismlauncher.org/download">grab the latest download here</a> for your respective platform.</p>

	<entry>
		<title>PolyMC Update 1.2.0, now available</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.2.0/"/>
		<updated>2022-04-17T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.2.0/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>Hey! It's update-time again. We have added lots of new things in this one and improved a few things as well.</p>
<h2 id="changelog" tabindex="-1">Changelog <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.2.0/#changelog" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="added" tabindex="-1">Added <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.2.0/#added" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Allow components to specify Java agents and JVM arguments by @unascribed in #175</li>
<li>Add support for Quilt loader by @Scrumplex in #185 #431</li>
<li>Add buttons to Matrix space and Reddit by @dada513 in #243 and @ZekeSmith in #390</li>
<li>Allow moving toolbars by @flowln in #305</li>
<li>Add Quit after game stop option by @dada513 in #341</li>
<li>Block game launch if Java is incompatible by @Scrumplex in #345</li>
<li>Add grayscale icon for monochrome icon themes by @embeddedt in #370</li>
<li>Track and display game world sizes by @Scrumplex in #373 #387</li>
<li>Add more detailed progress dialog for mod-downloader by @flowln in #380 #409</li>
<li>Add version selector for Technic modpacks by @jamierocks in #384</li>
<li>Add basic filtering to mod downloader by @flowln in #392</li>
<li>Lay groundwork for ARM64 support by @DioEgizio in #397</li>
<li>Add mod loader selection to instance creation by @kthchew in #398</li>
<li>Save custom offline player name by @vlaetansky &amp; @DioEgizio in #407</li>
<li>Add optional menu-bar and keyboard navigation by @kthchew in #411</li>
<li>[Linux] Provide portable builds by @DioEgizio in #351</li>
<li>[Windows] Add support for POLYMC_JAVA_PATHS by @FayneAldan in #357 #360</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="changed" tabindex="-1">Changed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.2.0/#changed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Improve mod downloader by @flowln in #220 #356 and @dada513 in #375 and @HarryPeach in #395</li>
<li>Switch logo font to Josefin Sans by @Scrumplex in #250</li>
<li>Updated Nix Flake by @Kranzes in #272</li>
<li>Combine portable and system builds by @Scrumplex in #336</li>
<li>Build script improvements by @oynqr in #333 #344 and @txtsd in #349 and @DioEgizio in #389</li>
<li>Update credits and branding by @Scrumplex in #352</li>
<li>Update license for logos by @ZekeSmith in #383 #385</li>

<li>Use system libraries if possible by @flowln in #436</li>

	<entry>
		<title>PolyMC Update 1.1.0, now available</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.1.0/"/>
		<updated>2022-03-12T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.1.0/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>We are pleased to announce, that PolyMC version 1.1.0 is now available!<br />
This is a major milestone, as this marks the first release since deciding to move on from our origins as a MultiMC fork.<br />
You can <a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/moving-on">read more about that here</a>.</p>
<h2 id="changelog" tabindex="-1">Changelog <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.1.0/#changelog" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="added" tabindex="-1">Added <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.1.0/#added" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>

<li>New option to close PolyMC after launch by @binex-dsk in #79</li>
<li>Now detects Java from environment by @muscaln in #46</li>
<li>New <code>Open page &amp; copy code</code> button in MSA login dialog by @Scrumplex  in #88</li>
<li>Added StartupWMClass to .desktop file so DEs can behave by @danielhuang in #95</li>
<li>Added PolyMC news by @dada513 in #151</li>
<li>Added CurseForge and Modrinth mod downloader by @timoreo22 in #64 #129 #183 #205 #207 and @flowln in #193 #221</li>
<li>New CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 license for PolyMC logos and branding by @ZekeSmith in #149</li>
<li>Added MSA-Client-ID override in UI by @Scrumplex in #161</li>
<li>Added missing tooltip for instance export in #176</li>
<li>Added MSA Client ID change detection and prompt by @Scrumplex in #180</li>
<li>Added Matrix space link by @dada513 in #243</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="changed" tabindex="-1">Changed <a class="direct-link" href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/release-1.1.0/#changed" aria-hidden="true">#</a></h3>
<ul>

<li>Replaced <code>paste.ee</code> with <code>0x0.st</code> and <code>paste.polymc.org</code> by @binex-dsk in #67</li>
<li>Updated information in the About dialog by @redstrate in #108</li>
<li>Migrated to upstream QuaZip 1.2 by @Scrumplex in #92</li>
<li>QuaZip is now linked statically by @Scrumplex in #126</li>
<li>Internal libraries are now linked statically by @Scrumplex in #143</li>
<li>PolyMC specific translations now hosted on weblate by @Scrumplex in #152 #199</li>
<li>Update metadata by @dada513 in #145</li>
<li>Version string now shows the branch that PolyMC was built from by @Scrumplex in #160</li>

	<entry>
		<title>Moving on</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/moving-on/"/>
		<updated>2022-03-06T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/moving-on/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>PolyMC emerged out of frustration with the MultiMC project and therefore brought controversy with it.<br />
In short, the original founders of PolyMC had disagreements with the maintainer of MultiMC and the project's direction.<br />
These disagreements were turned into a takeover of packaging on Arch Linux by the PolyMC founders, something that, understandably, the <a href="https://github.com/PolyMC/PolyMC/issues/75#issuecomment-1023571223">MultiMC maintainers took as sabotage</a>.<br />
After MultiMC <a href="https://www.reddit.com/r/linux_gaming/comments/riitbs/multimc_is_dropping_all_support_for_aur_packages/">dropped support for third-party packaging</a>, the seeds for PolyMC were laid.</p>
<p>As a side note, we want to mention that we do not approve the actions of community members that used these controversies as a basis to harass MultiMC developers.<br />
Please refrain from brigading other communities.<br />
It only causes harm on both sides.</p>
<p>PolyMC's inception is very controversial by its very nature.<br />
The founders have decided to sublicense PolyMC under the terms of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GNU_General_Public_License">GNU General Public License 3</a> (GPL-3), which made it impossible for MultiMC to take contributions, without re-licensing to GPL-3 as well.<br />
As a result the MultiMC team have decided to burn bridges with PolyMC.<br />
This was manifested after access to the metadata service, provided by MultiMC, was <a href="https://github.com/PolyMC/PolyMC/issues/75">blocked for all PolyMC users</a>.<br />
All versions prior to 1.0.6 do not work anymore, as they try to reach MultiMC servers instead of our own.</p>
<p>In an effort to prepare for our upcoming 1.1.0 release, we wanted to contact the MultiMC maintainer to see, if they want to be credited in our documentation.<br />
Sadly, our request was dismissed, and most of our team members were banned from the official MultiMC Discord server for being associated with PolyMC.</p>
<img alt="Screenshot of public chat with MultiMC maintainer" src="https://prismlauncher.org/img/news/moving-on/discord.png" style="width: 40em" />
<p>This has sparked many internal discussions both at PolyMC and MultiMC.<br />
In the end, we concluded that we will be moving on from our origins as a packaging-friendly fork of MultiMC.</p>
<p>In our upcoming 1.1.0 release, you will be able to use new features that will differentiate PolyMC from MultiMC.<br />
The major new feature is the integrated mod downloader that supports Modrinth and CurseForge mods.<br />
We also plan to clean the codebase, remove obscure or old features and cruft in an effort to make it easier for new contributors to start working on PolyMC.</p>
<p>Additionally, we have reorganized PolyMC since its inception to be more community-centric.<br />
One of the founders has stepped down as a maintainer, and we have formed the <em>PolyMC Core Team</em>.<br />
You can read more about it in <a href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/new-maintainers/">this blogpost</a>.</p>
<p>We want to decouple this project from its controversial origins and start work on a powerful Minecraft launcher.<br />
While we are working on getting 1.1.0 out, check out our future plans:</p>
<p><strong>Sneak peek of future plans</strong>:</p>
<ul>
<li>Rewrite of metadata generators, to make them easier to work with. See progress over on <a href="https://github.com/PolyMC/polymorphosis">PolyMC/polymorphosis</a></li>
<li>Potential rewrite of the launch-mechanism for Minecraft. This will give future alternative launchers the tools to build their own. See progress over on <a href="https://github.com/PolyMC/PolyMC/issues/167">PolyMC/PolyMC#167</a></li>
</ul>
<p>If you want to be involved in PolyMC, check out the following links:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/PolyMC">PolyMC GitHub Organization</a></li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/PolyMC/PolyMC">PolyMC Source Code</a></li>
<li><a href="https://discord.com/invite/xq7fxrgtMP">PolyMC Discord server</a></li>
<li><a href="https://matrix.to/#/#polymc:matrix.org">PolyMC Matrix Space</a> (bridged with Discord)</li>
</ul>
<hr />
<blockquote>
<p>Never dig straight down!</p>
</blockquote>
<p>~ PolyMC Core Team</p>
</content>
	</entry>

	<entry>
		<title>New maintainers and step down.</title>
		<link href="https://prismlauncher.org/news/new-maintainers/"/>
		<updated>2022-02-06T00:00:00Z</updated>
		<id>https://prismlauncher.org/news/new-maintainers/</id>
		<content type="html"><p>Based off recent controversies, and for the project's best interest, Swirl has stepped down from his role as maintainer. LennyMcLennington is now the head maintainer of PolyMC and has established a new core group of maintainers to keep the project healthy and active.</p>
<p><strong>Swirl Stated</strong>:</p>
<blockquote>
<p>@here Based on recent controversies, and in thinking of the general future of this project, I believe it to be best if I step down from my leadership position in PolyMC.</p>
<p>Lenny will now be maintaining PolyMC and all its related services, and will be establishing a core team to help with development resources and community management.</p>
<p>Additionally, due to mental health and other personal reasons, I will be taking a break from--and generally will be unavailable for--contributing to the project.</p>
<p>Thank you all for providing me a great community to work with. I pray for PolyMC to have a good future and for all of you to continue to do good for the Free Software community.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>Quote in news: <a href="https://discordapp.com/channels/923671181020766230/923672379144671263/939731859431100416">Discord</a></p>
<p>Swirl contributed a lot to PolyMC, and we hope to see more contributions in the future.</p>
<p>In lighter news, congratulations to our new Core Team consisting of:</p>
<ul>
<li>LennyMcLennington</li>
<li>Scrumplex</li>
<li>timoreo</li>
<li>txtsd</li>
<li>dada513</li>
<li>Ezekiel Smith</li>
<li>cozyGalvinism</li>
</ul>
<p>We will be maintaining the PolyMC project and repositories. We hope to see great contributions and continued development of PolyMC.</p>
<p>~ PolyMC Team</p>
</content>
	</entry>
